title: Casey Laulala
text:
Casey Daniel Eti Laulala (born 3 May 1982) is a <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a>n-born New Zealand former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Career.
Born and raised in <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a>, Laulala started boarding at <a href="Wesley%20College%2C%20Auckland">Wesley College</a> when he was 15.
Laulala made his test debut for <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> during the team's November–December 2004 end of year tour against <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>. He has played three games for the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, including two tests. Laulala played for the <a href="Crusaders%20%28rugby%29">Crusaders</a> Super 14 team and for <a href="Canterbury%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Canterbury</a> during the <a href="Air%20New%20Zealand%20Cup">Air New Zealand Cup</a>. Laulala attended <a href="Wesley%20College%2C%20Auckland">Wesley College, Auckland</a> for his schooling.
Laulala scored the match winning try for his side during the <a href="2006%20Super%2014%20Final">2006 Super 14 Final</a>, the match nicknamed "Gorillas in the Mist" because of the dense fog. The next day he was recalled to the All Blacks, being named in the squad to play <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a>. He later went on to earn his second Test cap against Ireland in Auckland.
Cardiff Blues.
Laulala signed for Welsh side <a href="Cardiff%20Blues">Cardiff Blues</a> for the 2009/10 season. He won the <a href="Amlin%20Challenge%20Cup">European Challenge Cup</a> with the side in May 2010. Laulala scored 14 tries during his 58 appearances for the club.
Munster.
On 9 February 2012, <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster Rugby</a> confirmed Laulala as their second major signing for the 2012/13 season, alongside Northampton's Irish centre <a href="James%20Downey%20%28rugby%20union%29">James Downey</a>. He arrived to join up with Munster in May 2012.
Laulala made his full Munster debut on 1 September 2012, starting at outside centre in his side's opening <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Pro%2012">2012–13 Pro 12</a> fixture against <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh</a>. He scored his first try for Munster on 2 November 2012, against his old club <a href="Cardiff%20Blues">Cardiff Blues</a>. Laulala scored his second try for Munster on 30 March 2013, in a heavy loss to <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>.
He won the Man-of-the-Match award for Munster in their 10–31 away win against <a href="Cardiff%20Blues">Cardiff Blues</a> on 23 November 2013. It was confirmed on 15 December 2013 that Laulala would be leaving Munster at the end of the 2013–14 season. Laulala scored a try in Munster's 47-23 Heineken Cup quarter-final win against <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Toulouse</a> on 5 April 2014. He was named in the 2013-14 Pro 12 Team of the Season on 5 May 2014.
Racing 92.
Laulala currently plays for French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> side <a href="Racing%2092">Racing 92</a>.
Barbarians.
On 23 May 2013, Laulala was named in the <a href="Barbarians%20F.C.">Barbarians</a> team to face <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> on 26 May. He also played against the <a href="British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions">British & Irish Lions</a> in their opening <a href="2013%20British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions%20tour%20to%20Australia">tour</a> fixture on 1 June 2013.
